definitions.definition: an official who acts as a judge in the lowest courts of law

examples.text: to come up before the magistrates
A magistrate ordered that they return to the UK.
He is due to appear before magistrates on a charge of assault.
She was granted bail by Liverpool magistrates.
The prosecutor submits a dossier to an examining magistrate.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Latin magistratus ‘administrator’, from magister ‘master’.
